fields.headline: Suspect arrested for Bowen mugging
fields.bodyText: A man has been arrested on suspicion of robbing BBC1 Breakfast News presenter Jeremy Bowen at knife point. Bowen, 41, was punched twice in the face and threatened with a knife before his assailant ran off with his wallet. The former Middle East correspondent had been making his way back to his home in Camberwell, south London at 2am on October 19 after attending an awards ceremony. Bowen said after the attack that he was "bruised and shocked, as you can imagine." The 32-year old man was arrested at an address in Kennington, south London at 7.30am today, said a Scotland Yard spokeswoman. He was being questioned on suspicion of robbery and supplying drugs.
